oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Metagenomic evaluation of the dairy farm environment and facilities for evidence of digital dermatitis-associated bacteria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rock, C.
Krull, A.
Gorden, P.
Shearer, J.
Plummer, P. J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine digital dermatitis
BDD
lameness
beef cattle
dairy cattle
lesions
bacterial organisms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine digital dermatitis is a common polybacterial disease process and a leading cause of lameness in dairy and beef cattle. Mature lesions are associated with a very high abundance of Treponema spp organisms, while developing lesions have a larger diversity with different populations of organisms. This study was designed to utilize 16S-based phylogenomics to evaluate a variety of environmental samples obtained from various areas of a dairy farm for the presence of bacterial organisms associated with digital dermatitis lesions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2016; 174
